its vibrant leaf coloration while avoiding leaf burn.
It can adapt to medium light conditions, but reduced light might
result in slower growth and less striking variegation.
In low light, this plant will survive but its growth will be stunted
and its variegation may become less pronounced over time.
Protect the plant from direct sunlight, especially during peak
hours, as intense rays can scorch the delicate leaves.
watering: Water the Variegated String of Hearts thoroughly, allowing the soil
to dry out completely between waterings to prevent root rot.
In their growing season, water more frequently to support healthy
growth, while in dormancy, reduce watering significantly.
Always use a pot with drainage holes to prevent standing water,
which can lead to harmful bacterial and fungal growth.

soil: Use a well-draining cactus or succulent potting mix that allows
excess moisture to escape and prevents water logging.
A mix containing perlite or coarse sand can improve aeration,
enhancing overall drainage capabilities for the plant.
Ensure the soil remains loose and airy to allow roots to spread
easily, promoting healthy and robust plant growth.
Avoid heavy soils that retain too much moisture, as they can lead
to root rot and other moisture-related issues.
toxic: The Variegated String of Hearts is considered non-toxic to pets
and humans, making it a safe choice for households with animals.
extra_care_tip: Regularly rotate the plant to ensure even growth and to prevent
it from leaning towards the light source.
Prune the plant to encourage bushier growth and to maintain an
optimal shape, removing any leggy or unhealthy stems.
